results.title: The Sound collector
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Lynn Smith, Ishu Patel and David Verrall
results.brief_description: The Sound Collector, an animation film that uses a combination of collage, paper cut-outs and colored inks on glass, features Leonard, a six-year-old with an unusual hobby. He collects sounds. Transforming household noises around him into exciting fantasies, he creates an adventure story for his scornful older brother in which knights in armor chase away monsters and perform other daring deeds. This film that will entertain young and old alike lends itself to a variety of classroom uses, to encourage creativity in children, and to stimulate discussion on topics such as individuality, family relationships, and imagination.

results.title: The Soul of St Kilda
results.brief_description: Like some other residents, Meyer believes that St Kilda Town Hall is the heart of the community. He takes us through the rich history that is on display on the walls of this great building.

results.title: The Soul of a man
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”. In his inimitable interpretation of the documentary Wim Wenders directs in a mixed form of dramatic re-enactment, interviews, clips and footage combined with contemporary musicians performing their own interpretations of some of the songs of the original era. This work explores three particular blues artists and their legacy of great music - Blind Willie Johnson, Skip James and J.B. Lenoir. Beginning in outer space, we learn that on a record sent to represent the human race is a blues song by Blind Willie Johnson. Wenders constructs a narrative to illustrate the possible life and times of Blind Willie, narrated in first person by Laurence Fishburne. Wenders then cuts to a live recording/performance of some of the songs by artists such as Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds, Lou Reed, Beck, Cassandra Wilson, Lucinda Williams and The Jon Spencer Blues Explosion, amongst others, throughout the biographical storytelling. Skip James was another extremely influential artist from the 1920/30s and his story is also re-created - how he won a competition to make a record but never saw any royalty money from it and then left music to start a ministry in the church. Thankfully he was re-discovered in 1965 and some rare live recordings are shown. Also re-discovered for this documentary is footage of the performer and songwriter J.B. Lenoir, seen in his coat-tail costumes, playing guitar and singing songs from his soul. Tragically lost to a car accident, his songs and influence are still felt today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wim Wenders, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)

results.title: The Sorcerer's apprentice (K)
results.brief_description: This is the classic Grimm’s fairytale brought to life by the narration of Vincent Price. This colourful animation tells of Spellbinder the Sorcerer who hires Hans as his apprentice, believing that Hans can neither read nor write. Hans is at first an enthusiastic apprentice, but after learning of Spellbinder’s evil ways, plans to use what he has read in the Book of Magic to defeat his master.

results.title: The Sorcerer's apprentice
results.brief_description: Animated version of the Grimms’ fairy tale narrated by Vincent Price. Spellbinder the Sorcerer hires Hans as his apprentice believing that Hans can neither read nor write. Hans is at first an enthusiastic apprentice, but after learning of spellbinder’s evil ways, plans to use his ability to read against Spellbinder. When Spellbinder challenges Hans to a duel of magic, Hans is able to use what he has read in the Book of Magic to defeat his master.

results.title: The Sopranos. Season 4
results.creator_credit: James Hayman, Alan Taylor, Daniel Attias, Steve Buscemi, Henry J. Bronchtein, Jack Bender, Tim Van Patten, John Patterson, Allen Coulter, David Chase, Ilene Landress, Chase Films, Brad Grey Television and Home Box Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Sopranos”.
Season four of this award-winning television series created by David Chase. The dark exploration of masculinity, abuse and violence which is central to this series exemplifies what is unique to The Sopranos: terrific writing, outstanding performances and a daring audacity to fully explore the brutality of contemporary culture in the US. The mores and ethics of organised crime seem an apt metaphor for the capitalist system. Ep 1 “For all debts public and private” Tony tries to raise cash for investments, whilst Carmela pushes for traditional insurance. Uncle Junior frets about his impending trial. Ep 2 “No show” With Paulie behind bars, Christopher is assigned his turf. Meadow considers taking a year off college. Ep 3 “Christopher” The first Soprano trial in 16 years commences; Italian pride causes an array of troubles. Ep 4 “The Weight” Johnny Sack embarks on a bloody vendetta; Carmela develops a close relationship with Furio, encountering Tony problems. Ep 5 “Pie o my” Carmela and Tony continue to disagree over the finances; Uncle Junior faces problems in court. Ep 6 “Everybody hurts” Tony gives greater responsibility to Christopher; Meadow joins the right side of the law. Ep 7 “Watching too much television” Tony and the gang throw a release-party for Paulie. Furio finds himself attracted to Carmela. Ep 8 “Mergers & acquisitions” Tony meets an attractive art dealer; Paulie tries to integrate his mother into her nursing home; Carmela discovers a new source of income. Ep 9 “Whoever did this” Uncle Junior develops a new defence strategy; Tony brings Svetlana back into their lives; tragedy strikes Ralph’s son. Ep 10 “The Strong, silent type” Tony tracks down Ralph; Furio struggles with his feelings for Carmela; Christopher’s heroin addiction turns catastrophic. Ep 11 “Calling all cars” Dreams persue Tony through the night; Tony contemplates business decisions; Dr Melfi works on the undercurrents of Tony’s dreams but he wants out. Ep 12 “Eloise” Tony haggles over profits; Paulie’s loyalty is called into question. Ep 13 “Whitecaps” Tony battles to keep the family together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Hayman, Alan Taylor, Daniel Attias, Steve Buscemi, Henry J. Bronchtein, Jack Bender, Tim Van Patten, John Patterson, Allen Coulter, David Chase, Ilene Landress, Chase Films, Brad Grey Television and Home Box Office
